column3: Could do as a scripted diff? :sweat_smile:

> Could do as a scripted diff? ðŸ˜…

That'd work well for renaming variables and constants (s/witness_program/witness_script/, s/MAX_PROGRAM_LENGTH/MAX_WITNESS_SCRIPT_LENGTH/), but not for longer comments, where "witness program" sometimes needs to remain unchanged. E.g. here, if I understood correctly: 

https://github.com/theStack/bitcoin/blob/8a2b58db9ee6a14d36b5d8e430b35f18e7c7b0c5/test/f

tACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22429/commits/8a2b58db9ee6a14d36b5d8e430b35f18e7c7b0c5\n\nI compiled and ran the functional tests to ensure everything is still passing. +1 on the concept, consistent naming is super helpful for new people on-boarding to the codebase
